SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Specify Default Pagination Options for All Sections of the My Account Page

When you show pagination controls in any section of the My Account page, you can specify which pagination options are available for a buyer to select.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set

You individually specify whether any pagination controls are available for the following sections of the My Account page:

Manage Address Book
My Orders
My Templates
My Subscriptions
My Invoices

When you enable pagination, you can configure the buyer experience in the following ways:

NOTE The options that you configure apply to all sections of the My Account page where pagination controls are available, not to a specific section. For example, you can't configure a particular pagination experience on the My Account page but a different pagination experience on the My Invoices page.
Page List Size (1)
The number of direct links to other pages of results that appear at one time. You can specify a maximum number of page links that can display at one time, regardless of how many pages of results there actually are. For example, maybe you want to make sure that at most four page links display, even if there are eight pages of results.
Items Per Page (2)
The number of results to show per page. You can specify multiple picklist values, and specify the default value.

To configure the buyer experience of the pagination controls, update your storefront configuration settings.

On the CC Admin tab in your org, select your storefront (1).
In the Storefront Settings menu, select Configuration Settings (2).
From the Module picklist, select Paginator (3).
To configure how many other pages of results are linked at any one time, find the Page List Size configuration (4), and check its value (5).
TIP
The default value—3—specifies that at most three other pages of results are linked at any one time. If you're satisfied with this behavior, continue to the next step.
To specify a different value, click Override in the Action column. In the New Page Setting window, enter a different number for Value, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Paginator
Configuration	Page List Size
Page	My Account
Value	An integer, such as 2 or 6.
To configure which options are available in the Items per Page picklist, find the Items Per Page configuration (6), and check its value (7).
TIP
The default value—10,25,50,75—specifies that a buyer can select 10, 25, 50, or 75 items per page of results. If you're satisfied with this behavior, continue to the next step.
To specify a different value, click Override in the Action column. In the New Page Setting window, enter a different number for Value, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Paginator
Configuration	Items Per Page
Page	My Account
Value	A comma-separated list of integers, such as 2,4,6,8.
To configure the value selected by default in the Items per Page picklist, find the Page Size configuration (8), and check its value (9).
TIP
The default value—10—specifies each section of the My Account page where pagination controls are available shows 10 items per page by default.
To specify a different value, click Override in the Action column. In the New Page Setting window, enter a different number for Value, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Paginator
Configuration	Page Size
Page	My Account
Value	One of the options you specified in the Items Per Page configuration. For example, if you entered 2,4,6,8 for Items Per Page, specify one of those values, such as 4.
Build and activate a new configuration cache.

Let us know so we can improve!

title: Configure Pagination Options in My Account Page
